author: Newsdesk
title: Chaka Khan retires from touring
text:
- ARTISTS
- NEWS
- UNDERGROUND
- TICKET NEWS
- COMPETITION
Chaka Khan is done with touring.
The Ain't Nobody hitmaker confirmed to Rolling Stone on Thursday that she intends to stop touring, although she will continue to perform live on select occasions.
Elaborating on her decision, the 70-year-old explained that there is more to her life than music.
"Some people, that's all they have, you know? I got this rich-a*s life. I've got great-grandchildren I want to get to know better," she stated. "So I will not do another tour. I'll do dates, but it won't look like a tour. They'll be far enough apart that I can have time to sleep in between."
When asked if she would ever retire altogether, the singer joked about musicians who dip in and out of retirement.
"Well, I might do that three or four times, like other b**ches do," she quipped.
Khan is next scheduled to perform in Los Angeles in January and she has several shows lined up in the U.K. in June and July.
Elsewhere in the interview, Khan claimed that she doesn't "really care" about her musical legacy.
"I would hope that some of my s**t has some longevity, but if it doesn't, that'll be because hopefully somebody better has come along," she said. "I just hope that the art form doesn't get so screwed up with stupid s**t - kids today think that every instrument can be played on a keyboard. Instruments have to be introduced once again to these kids."

author: 陈梦宇
title: 解锁"智驾险"，要有"新钥匙"_中国经济网
text:
“用智能辅助驾驶出了事故，谁来负责？”这个问题近期因特斯拉的“败诉”再度引发热议：8月初，美国法院以2.4亿美元的罚单判定特斯拉需为2019年一起涉及驾驶辅助系统的致死事故承担部分责任。
俗话说，一把钥匙开一把锁。锁变了，开锁自然要有新钥匙。随着自动驾驶技术朝着L3、L4乃至L5级别迈进，传统车险所提供的风险保障愈发捉襟见肘，“智驾险”便应运而生。然而，从现实情况来看，眼下的“智驾险”更像是一款提升用户使用智驾功能的延保服务，甚至被看作是应对赔付过程中信任危机的一剂“止疼药”。在理赔中，不可避免地会出现责任判定的障碍。
打造名副其实的“智驾险”需要若干基础条件。只有解锁的基础条件一一具备，才能配齐解决新问题的新钥匙。譬如，实现数据共享。评估风险需要海量车辆运行数据的积累，否则无法支撑精算模型。然而，当前智驾系统的日志数据由车企掌控，不但车主难以获取原始数据，而且第三方鉴定机构调取数据也常常吃“闭门羹”。这也加剧了定责不公正的风险。又如，打破“双重身份”。目前，车企既是“智驾险”的售卖方，又是规则制定者和赔偿责任的界定方，集裁判员与运动员的角色于一身。这也决定了，责任认定存在着“模糊地带”，“智驾险”甚至成了车企撇清责任的某种工具。
真正的创新是聚焦问题、解决问题。如何破解新需求带来的新问题呢？针对数据垄断的问题，可以由车企、险企、技术服务商、第三方鉴定机构共建数据共享平台。车企与险企可以改变传统的“销售代理”关系，形成“数据共享+联合开发”的协作关系，共同搭建智能驾驶保险定价体系，推动保险从事后理赔转向事前防控，协力为智能驾驶系紧安全带。而为了打破车企在理赔过程中的“双重身份”，有必要构建一套多方共治体系，重塑智驾的行业生态。具体来说，要建立健全数据监管机制，明确事故鉴定技术标准，形成“技术研发—标准引导—政策护航”的协同机制，推动“智驾险”从延保服务转变为真正的“标配服务”。
更多资讯或合作欢迎关注中国经济网官方微信（名称：中国经济网，id：ourcecn）

author: @rcnradio
title: ¿Carolina Cruz terminó su relación con Jamil Farah? | RCN Radio
text: Carolina Cruz desmintió rumores de separación con Jamil Farah Carolina Cruz ha causado varias polémicas por su relación con el piloto Jamil Farah. La presentadora colombiana Carolina Cruz ha decidido poner fin a los rumores que circulaban en redes sociales sobre una posible ruptura con el piloto Jamil Farah. Durante los últimos días, la ausencia de publicaciones juntos y la mudanza de Farah fuera del país para nuevos proyectos laborales alimentaron especulaciones sobre el estado de su relación. Ante la incertidumbre generada por los seguidores, Cruz utilizó su cuenta de Instagram para compartir una fotografía de Jamil Farah con la cabeza agachada, luciendo una gorra y con un filtro en blanco y negro. La presentadora acompañó la imagen con la frase en inglés "Miss U" (Te extraño en español), dejando claro que la distancia no ha afectado su relación. Le puede interesar: [Carolina Cruz presumió la presentación navideña de su hijo Matías: se mostró como una mamá orgullosa en sus redes sociales](https://www.rcnradio.com/entretenimiento/carolina-cruz-presumio-la-presentacion-navidena-de-su-hijo-matias-y-se-mostro-como) La pareja, que ha estado junta desde hace algunos meses, se había mostrado feliz y unida, pero la reciente partida de Jamil del país generó especulaciones sobre el futuro de su relación. La publicación de la presentadora busca poner fin a esos rumores y reafirmar que, a pesar de la distancia, el sentimiento entre ellos sigue intacto. La presentadora pasó las fiestas navideñas en Miami, acompañada de su familia, una tradición que ha mantenido a lo largo de los años. A través de las imágenes compartidas en sus redes sociales, se le vio disfrutando de momentos especiales con sus seres queridos, sin embargo, sus seguidores no dudaron en especular el fin de su relación con Jamil tras la ausencia de fotografías junto a él. Cabe recordar que Carolina ha experimentado con anterioridad la atención mediática en el ámbito sentimental. Después de su ruptura con el actor Lincoln Palomeque, la presentadora confirmó su relación con Jamil Farah, un piloto 12 años menor que ella. Aunque la pareja ha mantenido una presencia activa en redes sociales, la reciente mudanza de Jamil generó dudas entre los seguidores. Le puede interesar: [Paola Calle, mejor amiga de Carolina Cruz, revela que sufrió un derrame: empezó con un dolor de cabeza](https://www.rcnradio.com/entretenimiento/paola-calle-mejor-amiga-de-carolina-cruz-revela-que-sufrio-un-derrame-empezo-con-un) La historia de amor entre Carolina Cruz y Lincoln Palomeque, su ex pareja, también fue objeto de varias polémicas. A pesar de su separación, ambos han afirmado que mantienen una relación amistosa y que están comprometidos en ser buenos padres para su hija. Sistema Integrado Digital

author: @indiatoday
title: Thicker, stronger hair this monsoon: Achieve your hair goals with these 3 natural nutrients - India Today
text: Thicker, stronger hair this monsoon: Achieve your hair goals with these 3 natural nutrients While external factors like increased humidity and exposure to polluted rainwater can take a toll on your hair during the monsoon, focusing on internal nourishment can make a significant difference. Listen to Story As the monsoon season ushers in a welcome respite from the scorching summer heat, it also brings unique challenges for hair health. The increased humidity and exposure to rainwater can lead to hair problems, with studies suggesting that hair fall can increase by up to 30% during this season. This surge in hair loss is primarily due to elevated moisture levels causing hair follicles to swell and weaken, making them more susceptible to breakage and shedding. India Today spoke with Mihir Gadani, Biotechnologist and co-founder of OZiva to get more insights. Moreover, the monsoon creates an environment ripe for scalp issues. Rainwater, contrary to popular belief, often carries pollutants and harmful chemicals that can settle on the scalp, causing irritation and damage. The warm, damp conditions also provide an ideal breeding ground for fungal infections like dandruff, further compromising hair health. These factors combined make it crucial to pay extra attention to hair care this season. However, while external care is important, true hair health begins from within. You can maintain healthy, beautiful hair throughout the monsoon and beyond by focusing on three key ingredients - Biotin, Zinc, and Iron. These nutrients play vital roles in hair growth, strength, and overall health, providing your hair with the internal support it needs to withstand the challenging monsoon conditions. B7 AKA BIOTIN TO THE RESCUE: Biotin, also known as Vitamin B7, is a powerhouse nutrient for hair health. This essential vitamin plays a crucial role in the production of keratin, the protein that forms the structure of hair. During the monsoon, when hair is more vulnerable to damage and breakage, biotin becomes even more critical. Recent studies have shown that plant-based biotin, such as that derived from Sesbania Agati extracts, can significantly contribute to thicker, stronger hair in just a few months. Look for supplements that offer a high potency of biotin, ideally around 10,000 mcg per serving, to support hair growth and strength during the challenging monsoon season. Besides promoting hair health, biotin also supports healthy skin and nails, boosts immunity, and enhances energy and metabolism. ZINC, THE HAIR LOSS DEFENDER Zinc is an essential mineral that plays a multifaceted role in hair health. It supports a healthy immune system and is crucial for cell division - a process fundamental to hair growth. Moreover, zinc has been found to help block excess DHT (dihydrotestosterone), a hormone that can cause hair follicles to shrink and lead to hair loss in both men and women. During the monsoon, when the warm and damp conditions create an ideal environment for fungal infections on the scalp, zinc's immune-boosting properties become particularly valuable. Studies have shown that zinc derived from Guava Leaf extract can be particularly effective in strengthening hair follicles and nourishing hair roots. Consider incorporating zinc-rich foods into your diet or look for supplements that provide zinc from natural sources like Guava Leaf extract. The recommended daily intake of zinc is around 4% for optimal hair health benefits. THE SCALP OXYGENATOR, IRON! Iron deficiency is a common concern that can significantly impact hair health. This essential mineral is crucial for the production of haemoglobin, which carries oxygen to all cells in the body, including those in the hair follicles. During the monsoon, ensuring adequate iron intake becomes even more critical when hair falls tend to increase. Plant-based iron supplements can enhance iron absorption and red blood cell production, particularly those derived from sources like Curry Leaf extracts. Clinical studies have shown that iron extracted from Curry Leaf can provide up to 3.5% of the daily recommended intake, effectively improving oxygen supply to the scalp. This improved oxygenation can promote hair growth and overall vitality, helping your hair withstand the challenges posed by the monsoon weather. Remember, a healthy scalp is the foundation for healthy hair growth.

author: 中国新闻网
title: 海外华媒重庆行：农文旅、商贸、科技等多角度感知"魅力重庆"|重庆市_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
中新网重庆7月24日电 (张旭 杨思琦)7月23日，“行走中国·2025海外华文媒体川渝行”联合参访活动重庆段行程告一段落。
本次参访活动于7月17日在重庆中心城区启动。7月18日至23日，来自19个国家和港澳台地区的26家华文媒体组成的联合参访团，深入重庆忠县、江北区、两江新区、沙坪坝区，围绕“成渝地区双城经济圈建设”主题，开展深入参访和集中报道。
图为嘉宾正在拍摄重庆夜景。中新网记者 周毅 摄 在忠县，参访团一行走进“长江明珠”石宝寨、“三峡橘海”等地，观看了大型山水实景演艺《烽烟三国》，感受了重庆三峡库区特色农文旅产业的发展。新西兰BNE佳讯全媒体集团新媒体总编王紫璇说，在中国华侨国际文化交流基地石宝寨，华侨对祖国大好河山的热爱和对家乡的思念都会被激发。
“这几天的参观采访，让我留下美好而深刻的印象，也很有收获。”菲律宾《联合日报》记者龚文礼说，重庆的文化底蕴深厚，城市风光又很有特色，令人着迷、惊叹。
龚文礼说，她在重庆中国三峡博物馆参访时“一秒穿越千年”，又在“魅力重庆”无人机灯光秀的美景中，来了一场“历史与现代的碰撞”。
在江北，参访团一行走进人气旺盛的观音桥商圈，打卡“我在重庆”巨型广告屏，站在“江北a~台”体验“吞单轨”，感受城市活力的同时，热议如何用时尚元素让城市出圈。
老挝资讯网副总经理杨芳感叹，观音桥商圈将商业、文创、文旅有机结合，形成巨大流量效应和吸引力，值得老挝乃至更多东南亚国家学习。
在重庆两江新区，参访团一行体验了中国原创医疗设备“海扶刀”，感受了电子艾灸 机器人 的热刺激，走进一个个科技创新基地，感受新质生产力赋能千行百业。
香港01高级记者朱加樟说，此前只关注重庆文旅产业，到访以后，才知道山城在金融、科技等领域，亦有不少“行业领先”。
在沙坪坝，参访团一行走进重庆国际物流枢纽园区、千年古镇磁器口等地，感受了当地国际物流产业、文旅产业的蓬勃。
“山城的坡再陡，总有向上的脚步；江水再急，总有从容的舟楫。”杨芳说，带着这份独特的城市肌理与人文暖意告别重庆，故事“未完待续”。
接下来，参访团一行将继续深入四川省达州市、广元市、成都市参访，用笔触和镜头，向世界讲述巴蜀新故事。
据悉，“行走中国·2025海外华文媒体川渝行”联合参访活动由重庆市政府侨务办、重庆市政府新闻办、重庆市侨联、四川省侨务办、四川省政府新闻办、四川省侨联、中新社重庆分社、中新社四川分社、重庆海外联谊会、四川海外联谊会等共同组织。(完)
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->tourism and leisure industry

author: Don Bodger
title: Records fall in multiple communities as Island eases through mild December - Greater Victoria News
text: Three communities broke records as Vancouver Island waved goodbye to an extraordinarily dry and mild month. According to Environment Canada meteorologist Brian Proctor, warm weather records for December were either set or tied in Victoria, Comox and Campbell River. Those mild temperatures — echoed throughout the region — and lack of any snow will stand out as the most distinctive memory from December 2023. “December 2023 was mild with above normal temperatures, near normal rainfall and no snow,” noted Chris Carss, who records weather data for Environment and Climate Change Canada from his Chemainus home. “The lack of snowfall is becoming increasingly normal as regional and global temperatures continue to rise.” The mean daily maximum temperature for the month was 8.7 C, way above the normal of 6.4. The mean minimum was twice the normal, going from 2.4 C to 4.9 C. According to Carss’ observations, Dec. 1-5 had periods of rain with near normal temperatures rising to above normal; Dec. 6-8 was partly cloudy and dry with above normal temperatures dropping to near normal; Dec. 9-10 saw rain with near normal temperatures; Dec. 11-12 was partly cloudy and dry with near normal temperatures; and Dec. 13-21 had periods of rain with near normal temperatures rising to above normal. Meanwhile, Dec. 22-23 was partly cloudy and dry with above normal temperatures dropping to near normal; Dec. 24-30 saw periods of rain with near normal temperatures rising to above normal; and Dec. 31 was partly cloudy and dry with above normal temperatures. Following is a breakdown of Carss’ statistics for the month: Temperature Mean maximum 8.7 C, normal 6.4 C. Mean minimum 4.9 C, normal 2.4 C. Extreme maximum 12 C on Dec. 4 and 5. Extreme minimum 0 C on Dec. 23. Precipitation Total days with precipitation 20 (including mixed weather days), normal 21. Total accumulated rainfall 217.2 mm, normal 226.9 mm. Total accumulated snowfall 0 cm, normal 19.4 cm. Total accumulated precipitation 217.2 mm, normal 246.3 mm. Other Statistics Days mostly or partly sunny and dry 7, normal 5. Days with mixed weather 5. Total days mostly or partly sunny (including mixed weather days) 12. On Thetis Island, Keith Rush recorded 194.9 mm of precipitation for December at his Foster Point Road residence. That’s well below the 241.3 mm mark from December 2022. Total precipitation for all of 2023 on Thetis was 1,008.1 mm that’s just slightly below the 2022 total of 1,026.4 mm. Looking ahead, “January is expected to see similar or somewhat less rainfall than December and continuing mild weather with temperatures averaging about two degrees above normal,” Carss pointed out. “Rain can be expected on about half the days of the month with only occasional sunny breaks during the other 50 per cent of the month that doesn’t receive any rain.” —with a file from The Canadian Press READ ALSO: [Dry, warm B.C. December sets records in parts of the province](https://www.chemainusvalleycourier.ca/news/dry-warm-bc-december-sets-records-in-parts-of-the-province-7291860)

author: Kaitlin Gehlhaus
title: Skiers and snowboarders enjoy first snow of the season | ABC6
text: Skiers and snowboarders enjoy first snow of the season EXETER, R.I. (WLNE) — Skiers and snowboarders couldn’t wait to take to the slopes Sunday [despite the winter storm.](https://www.abc6.com/round-2-of-snow-will-taper-this-evening-icy-roads-remain-a-big-concern/) “I personally love snow,” Gabrielle Beaulie of West Warwick said. “It is one of my favorite parts about living in Rhode Island. I am super excited. It makes me really happy that it is snowing right now.” A full day of snowy conditions caused Yawgoo Valley ski area to draw in the crowds. “Honestly the weather is bringing in more people who would not normally ski today,” Operations Manager Danielle D’Andrea said. “The snow gets everyone excited and gets them thinking about us.” For some, today’s weather made it the perfect day to learn the slopes. “I am hoping it is the perfect conditions to learn how to ski, it looks pretty good out there,” Beaulie said. “I just hope it is not too slushy or too icy, hoping for no injuries.” For others, the drive to the ski area was not the easiest, but it was well worth it. “It was a little rough this morning but we are here and now we are going to have fun,” Layne Trimarchi of Providence said.
